intro: Pseudabutilon lozanoi, commonly known as the Bolivian abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, fuzzy leaves and showy, lantern-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange.
